description: Microsoft's OneNote for Windows 10 is the helpful note taking application to keep you organized for any project. Whether is it for working on a large project with co-workers to tracking recipes for dinner, OneNote is a great answer for keeping everything in one place. In this series, you will learn how to create and organize notebooks, add different types of content, stay on task with tags, use helpful features such as the OneNote Web Clipper, and share notebooks with others. This series specifically covers the OneNote application that is part of the Windows 10 operating system.
descriptionMD: Microsoft's OneNote for Windows 10 is the helpful note taking application to keep you organized for any project. Whether is it for working on a large project with co-workers to tracking recipes for dinner, OneNote is a great answer for keeping everything in one place. In this series, you will learn how to create and organize notebooks, add different types of content, stay on task with tags, use helpful features such as the OneNote Web Clipper, and share notebooks with others. This series specifically covers the OneNote application that is part of the Windows 10 operating system.
name: OneNote for Windows 10
subtitle: more onenote

episodes.description: Microsoft's OneNote for Windows 10 is the helpful note taking application to keep you organized for any project. Whether is it for working on a large project with co-workers to tracking recipes for dinner, OneNote is a great answer for keeping everything in one place. In this series, you will learn how to create and organize notebooks, add different types of content, stay on task with tags, use helpful features such as the OneNote Web Clipper, and share notebooks with others. This series specifically covers the OneNote application that is part of the Windows 10 operating system.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.025 --> 00:00:03.640
[SOUND] Hello everyone and

2
00:00:03.640 --> 00:00:09.153
welcome to OneNote for Windows 10.

3
00:00:09.153 --> 00:00:13.623
I'm your host Vonne Smith, and in this
course overview, we are going to be going

4
00:00:13.623 --> 00:00:18.080
over well, what exactly are we gonna
cover in this particular series?

5
00:00:18.080 --> 00:00:21.880
Who is this series for, do we need to
know anything before we get started,

6
00:00:21.880 --> 00:00:24.960
and any extra tidbits that
I have might for you.

7
00:00:24.960 --> 00:00:27.060
So, what are we gonna talk about?

8
00:00:27.060 --> 00:00:28.980
What we're gonna talk about
from the very beginning,

9
00:00:28.980 --> 00:00:31.750
we're gonna introduce what is OneNote?

10
00:00:31.750 --> 00:00:33.180
Why do we use it?

11
00:00:33.180 --> 00:00:37.890
What would I benefit from
by using this application?

12
00:00:37.890 --> 00:00:42.368
As we're gonna identify that, talk about,
there's OneNote for Windows 10 but

13
00:00:42.368 --> 00:00:44.184
then there's OneNote 2016.

14
00:00:44.184 --> 00:00:46.230
Are they different?

15
00:00:46.230 --> 00:00:49.545
They are, so that's why we have
two separate series on it.

16
00:00:49.545 --> 00:00:53.670
We're getting started with
the actual application

17
00:00:53.670 --> 00:00:57.910
by talking about a Microsoft account or
an Office 365 account.

18
00:00:57.910 --> 00:01:02.911
We talk about two different types of
users of this product, because of

19

course it is a application that works on
the operating system, not with Office 365.

20
00:01:09.211 --> 00:01:11.550
You don't have to have that there.

21
00:01:11.550 --> 00:01:15.530
So we're gonna get in, get started with
signing in, what about opening and

22
00:01:15.530 --> 00:01:16.280
closing our notebooks?

23
00:01:16.280 --> 00:01:17.510
What is OneDrive?

24

Where is it?

25
00:01:18.250 --> 00:01:20.680
Or at least that's where we're going
to be putting our files into, so

26

we cover all of that in this introduction.

27
00:01:24.000 --> 00:01:26.850
We also talk about the interface
of the application.

28
00:01:26.850 --> 00:01:29.390
Making sure you understand
where the ribbon is,

29

how to get around in your notebook,
and actually create a notebook.

30
00:01:32.390 --> 00:01:35.920
We'll start a brand new one and
create our sections and our pages.

31
00:01:35.920 --> 00:01:42.402
Then we'll move into adding content into

32
00:01:42.402 --> 00:01:45.800
We're gonna draw in there,
we have a lot of cool drawing tools.

33

And we're also going to add

34

And I normally think links
as like out to a website or

35

something like that,
we're talking about internal links.

36
00:01:56.480 --> 00:01:58.770
It's more of like cross referencing and

37

it's actually used to help navigate

38
00:02:03.510 --> 00:02:07.600
We're also going to be copying from

39
00:02:07.600 --> 00:02:08.738
which is really cool.

00:02:08.738 --> 00:02:13.130
And what OneNote does
automatically when we go ahead and

00:02:13.130 --> 00:02:16.170
get information from the Internet.

42
00:02:16.170 --> 00:02:20.140
We'll also insert some attachments,
we'll talk about the PDF print out and

we'll also add audio and

44
00:02:25.280 --> 00:02:30.110
Then we'll move into our topic of

45
00:02:30.110 --> 00:02:33.180
We're gonna tag stuff up,
what does that do for

46
00:02:33.180 --> 00:02:36.020
us and
how does it help organize ourselves?

47
00:02:36.020 --> 00:02:39.970
We'll also be using this search
functionality of OneNote, so

48
00:02:39.970 --> 00:02:43.910
hey I don't remember where I
put the stuff about the cats.

49
00:02:43.910 --> 00:02:47.610
Or I mean, it's gonna be everywhere but
we wanna go ahead and search for

50

that, so
we'll go through the search options.

51
00:02:50.120 --> 00:02:54.270
We'll also have a whole episode

manage where we're going to be
moving sections, moving pages.

53

How do we make section groups?

We're going to be going over all of that.

Stuff that may be covered in other places,

we try to keep it one

57

And then we're also gonna talk about

our deleted notes.

We're going to proof which isn't nearly as

We'll print, and then we'll also

which can be really handy and

More towards people maybe learning

63

or how to help with readers,

And maybe as an educator, or

use that to help somebody

And we'll move in to collaboration

we'll learn how to share notebooks.

00:03:45.870 --> 00:03:47.760
And then sometimes with notebooks,

you might not want people

And we'll also talk about how

meetings which could be Outlook,
we have that Outlook aspects since we

will have an account whether it's free or

I bet how you can use that to your

Who is this for?

Anybody really, you do not even have

have a computer with Windows 10, that's

So it can cover everybody,

whether you're an Office user as in

How can I use it to help organize it cuz
this is the digital notebook application

and it's really, really handy.

that might be kind of nice.

This is an application that

114

And just get in there, start playing

115
00:06:25.370 --> 00:06:26.510
we do have the episode notes.

116
00:06:26.510 --> 00:06:29.150
But I do refer to hey go ahead and

117

118
00:06:33.450 --> 00:06:37.090
That is included, but
there are now exercise files.

119

Side note, if you wanted a notebook,

But since it's a little different,

122
00:06:44.380 --> 00:06:48.090
you might not actually be able to
use those now that I think about it.

123
00:06:48.090 --> 00:06:50.380
So you know what,
just create your own, you'll be fine.

124
00:06:52.040 --> 00:06:52.990
What do we need to know?

125
00:06:52.990 --> 00:06:59.490
I just mentioned there is another series,
and I do cover OneNote in other platforms,

126
00:06:59.490 --> 00:07:06.360
meaning on a Macintosh environment, on
an Android phone, on a iPhone, on an iPad.

127
00:07:06.360 --> 00:07:12.800
So we just kind of glaze over it, this
particular version of 104 Windows 10 is

128
00:07:12.800 --> 00:07:17.360
going to be the most applicable
to your other platforms, okay?

129
00:07:17.360 --> 00:07:20.230
There are always gonna be little
differences here and there but

130
00:07:20.230 --> 00:07:23.630
if you wanna check that out,
I would go to that particular series.

131
00:07:23.630 --> 00:07:28.490
And if you just wanna learn more about
the OneNote 2016, we do talk about how

132
00:07:28.490 --> 00:07:33.060
this particular product, this meaning
OneNote 2016 sorry let me clarify that.

133
00:07:33.060 --> 00:07:37.410
Is not going to be archaic
to Microsoft anymore and

134
00:07:37.410 --> 00:07:42.120
the Windows 10 version is going
to become the new default.

135
00:07:42.120 --> 00:07:45.340
So that third bullet point on the side
right here updates happen it's

136
00:07:45.340 --> 00:07:48.130
gonna happen a lot in this product.

137
00:07:48.130 --> 00:07:54.020
I foresee this particular product being
upgraded pretty significantly, pretty

138
00:07:54.020 --> 00:07:59.923
regularly, over the course to kinda get
it up to speed to where it was in 2016.

139
00:07:59.923 --> 00:08:03.230
So updates are going to happen,
things are going to change in this.

140
00:08:03.230 --> 00:08:06.700
And of course,
there's always other options with that.

141
00:08:06.700 --> 00:08:09.090
I try to cover everything, but
I might have missed a few things.

142
00:08:09.090 --> 00:08:12.300
So there's always going to be other
ways to do the same things that

143
00:08:12.300 --> 00:08:13.860
I'm doing on the screen.

144
00:08:13.860 --> 00:08:16.560
You might find some different ways, and of
course, since we're gonna have all these

145
00:08:16.560 --> 00:08:20.310
updates, and we might find other ways
to do things, there's good answers.

146
00:08:20.310 --> 00:08:23.890
And go see the Microsoft support pages,
just go ahead, and

147
00:08:23.890 --> 00:08:28.010
use your favorite search engine,
and find the information about it.

148
00:08:28.010 --> 00:08:32.090
Definitely make sure you type
in OneNote for Windows 10,

149
00:08:32.090 --> 00:08:36.580
because you might find information
on 2016 that's not going to match.

150
00:08:36.580 --> 00:08:39.529
So be careful about that when you
are searching for your answers.

151
00:08:40.640 --> 00:08:44.980
Everybody uses products for different
reasons maybe you work, maybe you don't.

152
00:08:44.980 --> 00:08:50.110
Maybe you're a stay at home parent, that's
something that you can still utilize

153
00:08:50.110 --> 00:08:54.460
those products in your everyday life and
it can be really, really helpful for you.

154
00:08:54.460 --> 00:08:59.080
And of course, when you're learning,
I want you to have fun, try it out.

155
00:08:59.080 --> 00:09:01.210
That's the way that we
learn all these things,

156
00:09:01.210 --> 00:09:03.270
is just get in there, see what it can do.

157
00:09:03.270 --> 00:09:07.439
Watch these episodes, and then you try it
out on your own, and have fun doing it and

158
00:09:07.439 --> 00:09:09.867
I will see you very soon
in some future episode.

159
00:09:09.867 --> 00:09:16.625
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: Vonne and Aubri kick off the OneNote for Windows 10 series with an introduction and overview to the application. They discuss the difference between having just a Microsoft account vs Office 365 subscription, OneNote 2016 for Windows vs OneNote for Windows 10, and OneDrive for Business vs OneDrive for Windows 10.
episodes.title: Introduction to OneNote

episodes.description: OneNote is a default application for the Windows 10 operating system. While there is no installation needed, it is important to understand how the application works in conjunction with a Microsoft account or an Office365 subscription. In this episode, Aubri and Vonne show how to sign in and manage accounts to get started in OneNote.
episodes.title: Getting Started with OneNote

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Vonne explore the OneNote for Windows 10 environment and how to navigate in a notebook. They cover notebook structure, application settings, navigation panes, and how to open and close notebooks. They also discuss Quick Notes and how they are connected to the pin new page to start option.
episodes.title: OneNote Interface and Notebook Navigation

episodes.description: Aubri and Vonne discuss how to create a new notebook in OneNote. They demonstrate the steps to create a notebook that is stored in OneDrive, add sections and pages, and page view options. They also show how to delete notebooks in OneDrive.
episodes.title: Create a Notebook

episodes.description: It's great when everything goes perfect, but what about when it goes wrong? In this episode, Aubri and Vonne explore some common issues with notebooks in OneNote. They cover general network issues, sync issues and warning, and misplaced sections.
episodes.title: Troubleshooting OneNote

episodes.description: Aubri and Vonne start adding content to pages, specifically text and tables. They show how to add, select, move, resize, format, and manage text and table containers on a page.
episodes.title: Text and Tables

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Aubri show how to add images to notebook pages. They show how to add pictures from file, online, and camera as well as discuss the limited image formatting options (as compared to other Office products).
episodes.title: Images

episodes.description: Where does everyone go to research anything? The internet of course! In this episode, Vonne and Aubri take a look at copying information from the web to add a OneNote notebook as well as the OneNote Web Clipper.
episodes.title: Copy from Web and Web Clipper

episodes.description: A picture is worth a thousand words. Aubri and Vonne demonstrate how to use drawing tools and shapes. They cover the differences between the drawing tools, format drawn content, ink to text, and ink to shape. They also cover Office365 specific items such as glitter pens and Math.
episodes.title: Draw

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Aubri discuss links in OneNote 2016. They demonstrate how to create links from the Copy Link to from the right click menu as well as the Insert Link from the Insert tab. They also cover how to create links from typing shortcuts and troubleshooting non working links.
episodes.title: Links

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Vonne demonstrate how to attach files and insert a PDF printouts to pages. They emphasize these attachments are not links to original source files, but embedded copies. They also discuss the difference in how to work with attached files for both a free Microsoft account user and an Office365 user.
episodes.title: Attachments and Printouts

episodes.description: Sometimes it is easier to record a quick audio recording than write out a long note. In this episode, Vonne and Aubri demonstrate how to insert audio and video (using the Camera app and share command) in a OneNote notebook.
episodes.title: Audio and Video

episodes.description: Tagging content is a great way to stay organized. Search is great way to find content that you don't remember where you put it.  In this episode, Vonne and Aubri show how to use tags and the search features in OneNote for Windows 10.
episodes.title: Tags and Search

episodes.description: Vonne and Aubri discuss ways to organize and manage content in a notebook. They review topics from other episodes such as creating section groups, moving and copying pages and sections, creating subpages, marking content as read and unread, and the notebook recycle bin.
episodes.title: Organize and Manage

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Aubri discuss how to control history with page versions and deleted notes. They also cover how to proof notebook pages (limited compared to OneNote 2016), print pages and printing settings, and check accessibility.
episodes.title: History, Proof and Print

episodes.description: Vonne and Aubri take a look at the Immersive Reader and how it can be helpful for certain target audiences.
episodes.title: Immersive Reader

episodes.description: Sharing is caring. In this episode, Vonne and Aubri show how to share notebooks with others. They show how to share a notebook as an owner as well as how accept and access a share request as a recipient. They also show how to manage permissions to notebook files in OneDrive.
episodes.title: Share Notebooks

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Vonne show how to password protect sections in a notebook.
episodes.title: Password Protect

episodes.description: Vonne and Aubri demonstrate how to add details of calendar meetings and appointments into a page in OneNote as well as how to email pages to others. They also show how the Send to OneNote printer can work to send  email messages to a page in a notebook.
episodes.title: OneNote with Email and Meetings
